InfluenceRule.name: Outgoing people like to make up
Shy people are too scared to make up
Cold aren't loving enough to make up
Kind people are more likely to make up
Irritable people are less likely to make up
Loving people enjoy making up
Sympathetic people enjoy making up
Mean people hate to make up!
Confident people have the guts to approach their enemy and make up
Mopey people lack the initiative to make up with enemies
*** I is brainy but isn't liked, so will attempt to patch up broken bridges
As a dumb person I am less likely to makeup with you
As a deep person I can appreciate our differences, and I want to make up
I am shallow and I think you aren't cool, so I don't want to make up with you
As a smooth talker, I feel like I have the ability to make up with you
I am shallow and I think you ARE cool, so I DO want to make up with you
*** I am domineering but I like you so I will forcefully try to end our fight
I am humble and like to make up with people
I am arrogant and too proud to make up with you
I am a hothead and less likely to make up with you
I am forgiving, and thus very very likely to want to make up with you
I am pacifist, which generally makes me want to make peace with you
I is self desctructive, they aren't going to want to make up
I is vengeful, they aren't going to want to make up
I is competitive, they aren't going to want to make up
I is stubborn, they aren't going to want to make up
I is shaken, they want to eliminate their enemies
I is a bully, they probably won't want to make up
I is excited, and is therefore more likely to be happy and make friends with their enemy
I is looking for trouble, and would really prefer to not make up
I is in a good mood! I might very well make up with their enemy
I wants to pick on R, it is doubtful they will try to befriend them.
I envies R, so perhaps they can't stand the thought of making up with them.
I is grateful towards R, and will probably be nice to them!
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a shy person I appreciate this.
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a cold person I hate this.
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a kind person I like this.
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a sympathetic person I like this.
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a loving person I like this.
My enemy approaches me to apologize--as a mean person I hate this.
*** I'm insecure -- I don't trust my enemy to make up with me
I'm mopey -- it would be a nice change of pace to have this mean person be nice to me
Dumb people don't appreciate the social nuance of making up
Deep people can appreciate when someone is doing something difficult
***An inarticulate person may accidentally botch a responders attempt at friendship
A domineering person is likely to spurn someone making up with them
An arrogant person is too proud to accept someone to make up with them
Pacifists particularly like being made up to
Ripped people will only allow to be made up with if they think you are cool
Ripped people will only allow to be made up with if they think you are cool
Forgiving people love to be made up to
Emotional people are very likely to accept
Self Destructive people will not accept a make up
Vengeful people will not accept a make up
Competitive people will not accept a make up
Stubborn people will not accept a make up
Responder is popular, but Initiator is Not -- not gonna accept make up
*** Responder is a rebel, and isn't gonna accept no pansy attempts at friendship
Responder is a bully that doesn't like making up
Responder wants to pick on the initiator, enjoys being enemies with them
Responder is scared of the Initiator, and will leap on the chance to stop fighting with them
Responder feels superior to them, less likely to accept a make up
Initiator did something cool to the responder recently, more likly to make up
Initiator did something nice to the responder recently, more likly to make up

Effect.PerformanceRealization: %i% tried to make up with %r% but got a sick burn instead
%i% %pron(i,was/were)% cool enough to resolve %pron(i,his/her)% differences with %r%
%r% felt okay about not being enemies with %i% any more
%i% tried to make up with %r% but %pron(i,was/were)% kind of a jerk about it
%r% held a grudge against %i% and wouldn't make up
%i% thought %pron(i,his/her)% coolness was enough to make up with %r%
%r% %pron(r,was/were)% too into %i% not to make up
%i% %pron(i,was/were)% nice enough to %r% that %list(i,r,we/they)% stopped being enemies
%i% got tired of being frenemies with %r%
%r% %pron(r,was/were)% a complex individual who needed a frenemy, and/or treatment
%r% %pron(r,was/were)%n't willing to bury the hatchet with %i% despite %list(i,r,our/their)% mutual friendship with %o%
%r% belittled %i% for suggesting %list(i,r,we/they)% stop fighting for %op% sake

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, it's %i%. What do YOU want?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey look... I'm sorry for like pissing you off or whatever. This whole thing is lame. Can we just be cool?
%greeting%, %r%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What do you want now?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey look... I don't know why you're so pissed at me. I'm like sorry or whatever. Are we cool?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Why %i%, I'm SO happy to hear you say that!
You really want to be friends? Goody!
No. Now go away, you're blocking my cell signal.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey, wassup.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What do YOU want, %i%?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look... this whole enemies thing is lame. Can't we just be cool?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I guess you are pretty cool.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Rock on.

Instantiation.name: MakeUp - Feeling Good About You Accept

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey... sorry about everything. This is lame. Can we like not be enemies any more?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I guess %if(0,I owe you one)%elseif(1,you can get away with it)%elseif(2,I trust you not to be an idiot)%else(so)%.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %positiveAdj%, man. %positiveAdj%.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What do you want now?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I don't know what your deal is. Can't we like be friends or whatever?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Was that supposed to be an apology?
You are such a jerk.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: So... we're friends now?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Get lost.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey, %r%, wait up a sec.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: As if.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Look, I don't know what your deal is. Are you mad about that time when %toc1%?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: That's as good a reason as any.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Hey, %r%... Don't you think we've been at this whole enemies thing for long enough?
Come on. Look, I'm a cool %gender(i,guy,girl)%, right? Can't we just get along?
What!? I don't understand.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Shame all that coolness doesn't come with a nice brain.
Oh great, %i%. What do you want?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%.. I don't know why you're playing these games. It's obvious you're totally into me.
See! You can't be enemies with someone as hot as me. Come on, let's just make up and put this behind us.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well, not that... I mean you....... okay.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %greeting% buddy! How yah doing?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: What did you just call me?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Buddy? Like budski, buddino, the budders, budowski? You know, like - we're buds, right?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Uhhh.. I thought we were enemies?

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Really? Nahhhh.. That's so last week. Come on budowski, keep with the times!

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Well... I guess you've been less of a %pejorative% lately, so...
We could try it.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, what's going on between us? I don't know whether you genuinely like me or are just pretending to.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: And I don't know if you actually hate me or just do a good impression of someone who does.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I don't hate you. Most of the time anyway.
Can't we all just get along?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh god, so cheezy. But...
I suppose we could try it.
Look, %i%. I know what you're going to say and just don't bother.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I don't get you %r%. Sometimes I'm not sure if you're my best friend or if you want to kill me.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I AM A COMPLEX INDIVIDUAL!
I need someone I can *hate* and *love* at the SAME TIME!
Maybe one day, when you're older, you'll understand.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: And maybe one day, when I'm older, you'll be in a mental institution.

Instantiation.name: MakeUp - our mutual friend would want it that way Accept

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, look. It's silly of us to keep fighting. I mean, think how hard this must be for %o%. %gender(o,He,She)% is friends with both of us and right in the middle of this.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't see what %o% has to do with what a %pejorative% you are...
...but maybe we could try being a little nicer to each other. At least when %gender(o,he,she)%'s looking.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sounds good. See you around.

Instantiation.name: MakeUp - our mutual friend would want it that way Reject

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, look. It's silly of us to keep fighting. I mean, think how hard this must be for %o%. %gender(o,He,She)% is friends with both of us and right in the middle of this.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't see what %o% has to do with what a %pejorative% you are...
...and I can't imagine what %pron(o,he/she)% sees in you. Now get out of here and stop breathing my air.

Instantiation.name: MakeUp - my boyfriend would want it that way Accept

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, look. You're dating my friend %o%, which makes it really awkward for us to be at each others' throats all the time. Don't you think we can bury the hatchet?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't see what my %sweetie% has to do with you, %pejorative%...
...but maybe we could try being a little nicer to each other. At least when %gender(o,he,she)%'s looking.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: Sounds good. I won't tell anyone else if you won't.

Instantiation.name: MakeUp - my boyfriend would want it that way Reject

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: %r%, look. You're dating my friend %o%, which makes it really awkward for us to be at each others' throats all the time. Don't you think we can bury the hatchet?

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: I don't see what my %sweetie% has to do with you, %pejorative%...
And frankly, I wish you'd stop bothering %pron(o,him/her)%. I'm sure %pron(o,he/she)% feels the same way.

LineOfDialogue.initiatorLine: I'm sure %pron(o,he/she)% doesn't, %pejorative%. I hope %pron(o,he/she)% dumps you before your poison fangs sink any deeper into %pron(o,his/her)% throat.

LineOfDialogue.responderLine: Oh, my. Temper temper.
